tasks.context:
## Security Context
ZERG executes subprocess commands, spawns Docker containers, and mounts host directories.
Attack surface: subprocess execution (zerg/launcher.py), Docker container management, host filesystem via git worktrees, credential handling (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, OAuth tokens in ~/.claude).
Existing security: OWASP Top 10 2025 rules auto-fetched, language-specific rules (Python, JS, Docker), security rule filtering per file type.
Repository: github.com/rocklambros/zerg

tasks.context:
## Context Engineering (from docs/context-engineering.md)
Three subsystems: Command Splitting, Security Rule Filtering, Task-Scoped Context
Token overhead per worker: 15,000-30,000 tokens without optimization
Command splitting: .core.md (~30%) + .details.md (~70%), 10 commands split
Task context budget: ~4000 tokens per task in task-graph.json context field
Security rules: filtered by file extension (.py → Python rules, .js → JS rules)

## Core Principles (from CLAUDE.md)
- Spec as memory: workers read spec files, not conversation history
- File ownership: each task owns specific files, no conflicts
- Verification: every task has automated verification command
- Levels: tasks grouped by dependencies, all finish L1 before L2
